arm_group.description: patients in class 1 will have a follow up call with therapeutic education every 3 months. this is the light follow up.
patients in class 2 will have a follow up call with therapeutic education every month. this is the moderate follow up
patients in class 3 will have a follow up call with therapeutic education twice a month. this is the heavy follow up.

brief_summary.textblock:
A first therapeutic education is given before patient's discharge at the hospital, then a
      dedicated nurse follows patients through the phone,regularly according to patients' needs,
      continues to give advise on risk factors, information on medication and alert symptoms and
      therapeutic education.

clinical_study.brief_title: Platform Therapeutic Education in Heart Failure and Coronary Disease

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients are assigned to an arm accordingly to their needs: class 1 with light therapeutic
      education, class 2 with moderate education, class 3 with heavy education. Assignement is
      based on the first education diagnosis during hospitalization time.

      Quality of life and patient's knowledge are regularly evaluated through questionnaires

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  hospitalization for acute coronary syndrome (ST-segment elevation myocardial
             infarction ,no ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction ST  , unstable angina)

          -  hospitalization for heart failure

          -  acute coronary syndrome < 3 months

          -  heart failure < 3 months

          -  coronary by-pass surgery < 3 months

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  complicated acute coronary syndrome  (ventricular arrhythmia, heart failure,
             mechanical complications, cardiogenic shock)

          -  valvular cardiac pathology

          -  obstructive cardiomyopathy

          -  planned cardiac transplantation

          -  severe neurological or psychiatric troubles

          -  loss of autonomy

          -  other (refusal, language, nursing house, way of life not compatible with follow up,
             refusal of telephonic contacts)

intervention.description: knowledge of disease, risk factors, diet, medication, alert symptoms

clinical_study.official_title: Telephonic Platform of Follow up, Therapeutical Education and Coordination in Secondary Prevention in Patients With Heart Failure and Coronary Disease

primary_outcome.description: quality of life is evaluated with appropriate questionnaires
primary_outcome.measure: number of patient with a better of quality of life

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: head of the departement of cardiology,Saint Antoine hospital , Paris

secondary_outcome.description: Knowledge of disease includes risk factors, symptoms, medication, diet. It is evaluated with appropriate questionnaires.
secondary_outcome.measure: number of patients who improve their knowledge of disease

secondary_outcome.description: hospitalizations are recorded during the year of follow up, with cause and duration.
secondary_outcome.measure: number of hospitalizations during the follow up

collaborator.agency: union nationale de formation et d'evaluation en medecine cardio-vasculaire

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
